chapter.title: Touch-Examples User Guide
chapter.para: Touch implements some of the examples of the book ''A Touch of Class''.

section.title: How does this application work?
section.para: Each chapter respectively each example has its own application. All examples look almost the same, except for some minor changes to meet the requirements of the individual exercise.

The window contains a square to display the map and a control panel at the right side. The control panel consists of two parts: One is for navigating throuch the map using for example zoom in or zoom out and the other is the console where possible output is displayed.
Dependant on the exercise there are more buttons to click (for example a restart button etc.).
The button ''click here'' starts the execution of the example.

section.title: Navigation
section.para: You navigate on the map by pressing the mouse buttons.

listitem.para: Pressing the left mouse button while moving the mouse up or down will lift the map up or push it down.
Pressing the right mouse button while moving the mouse will scroll the map.
Moving the mouse up or down while pressing the middle mouse button will zoom in or out.
Clicking the left mouse button will select places or lines.
